data.event: It was abandoned sometime before 1750, and the former residents likely founded the newer village at Canandaigua.

event.title: 1789, the town of Hopewell, New York, was originally part of a tract of land first called

data.event: Settled beginning in 1789, the town of Hopewell, New York, was originally part of a tract of land first called "District of Easton" and then "Lincoln" and was part of the Phelps and Gorham Purchase of 1788.
